decks.notes: The main concept of this control deck is to disrupt your opponent's game plan through counterspells, removal spells, and board wipes, while drawing cards and gaining incremental advantage with cards like Search for Azcanta and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria. The deck aims to control the game until it can reach its win condition, which is usually by outvaluing the opponent with powerful spells and efficient creatures like Torrential Gearhulk. The deck also has some utility lands like Field of Ruin to disrupt the opponent's mana base and Arch of Orazca for additional card draw.

This deck focuses on building a strong board presence early in the game with efficient creatures like Walking Ballista, Winding Constrictor, and Jadelight Ranger. It utilizes cards like Glint-Sleeve Siphoner and Llanowar Elves to ramp up mana quickly and maintain card advantage. The deck also includes removal spells like Vraska's Contempt and Ravenous Chupacabra to control the board and deal with opponents' threats. The inclusion of Verdurous Gearhulk and Rishkar, Peema Renegade provides additional ways to boost the power of creatures on the battlefield. The ultimate goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a powerful and aggressive strategy.

The focus of this deck is to maintain a fast and aggressive playstyle by utilizing cards that generate energy and provide strong creatures to apply pressure on the opponent. The combination of Winding Constrictor and Walking Ballista allows for an efficient way to deal damage and gain board advantage. The inclusion of cards like Jadelight Ranger and Glint-Sleeve Siphoner provide card advantage and help to maintain momentum. Additionally, the deck has removal spells like Fatal Push and Ravenous Chupacabra to deal with opponent threats. Liliana, Death's Majesty can also be used to reanimate creatures for added value.

This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence and overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. It aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently, utilizing cards like Soul-Scar Mage, Goblin Chainwhirler, and Hazoret the Fervent to put pressure on the opponent. The deck also includes removal spells like Abrade and Unlicensed Disintegration to deal with threats from the opponent. Rekindling Phoenix and Glorybringer provide powerful flying threats that can quickly close out the game. The deck aims to be fast and relentless in its aggression.

The key concept of this deck is to use cycling cards like New Perspectives and Shadow of the Grave to draw through the deck quickly, while also gaining life with Faith of the Devoted. The deck aims to set up a combo utilizing Razaketh's Rite to tutor for key pieces like Gift of Paradise and Haze of Pollen, allowing the player to create a loop of cycling and gaining life to eventually win the game. The mana base is set up to ensure smooth mana production and cycle lands for card advantage.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on quickly bringing out powerful creatures like Goblin Chainwhirler, Rekindling Phoenix, and Hazoret the Fervent to deal damage to the opponent swiftly. The deck also includes burn spells like Abrade and Unlicensed Disintegration to remove threats on the opponent's side of the board. The mana base is efficient, allowing for consistent plays and aggressive attacks. By prioritizing speed and aggression, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly apply pressure on the opponent by playing low-cost aggressive creatures and burn spells. It aims to end the game as fast as possible by dealing damage directly to the opponent's life total and controlling the board with efficient removal spells. The deck's strategy revolves around utilizing its creatures' abilities to create a fast and relentless offensive pressure, while also having the flexibility to deal with opposing threats through burn spells. It is designed to win through quick and explosive bursts of damage.

The main focus of this deck is on early aggression and utilizing cheap burn spells to quickly reduce your opponent's life total. The deck includes several aggressive creatures like Spellweaver Eternal, Soul-Scar Mage, and Ghitu Lavarunner, as well as powerful spells like Wizard's Lightning and Lightning Strike to control the board and finish off opponents. Adeliz, the Cinder Wind serves as a powerful finisher, while Warlord's Fury and Opt provide card advantage and help maintain tempo. The mana base is streamlined with Sulfur Falls and Spirebluff Canal, ensuring consistent mana access for quick and explosive plays.

The deck focuses on quickly controlling the board by removing opposing threats with cards like Cast Down, Fatal Push, and Vraska's Contempt, while also disrupting the opponent's hand with Kitesail Freebooter. It then aims to close out the game aggressively with creatures like Champion of Wits, Ravenous Chupacabra, and The Scarab God. The deck also has card draw options like Chart a Course and Glint-Sleeve Siphoner to maintain resources. Overall, the strategy revolves around a balance of aggression, removal, and card advantage to outpace and overwhelm the opponent.

This deck focuses on using a variety of counterspells, removal spells, and powerful creatures to control the game and prevent the opponent from developing a threatening board state. It utilizes cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Torrential Gearhulk to generate card advantage and maintain control of the battlefield, while also having access to powerful removal spells like Vraska's Contempt and Fatal Push to deal with threats. The deck aims to out-value and outlast the opponent until it can secure a win condition with The Scarab God or other finishers.

This deck focuses on building a strong board presence quickly by playing efficient creatures and using counters synergies to overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing cards like Winding Constrictor and Verdurous Gearhulk, the deck aims to quickly pump up its creatures and deal damage to the opponent. The inclusion of removal spells like Ravenous Chupacabra helps to control the board and clear the way for powerful attacks. With a combination of aggressive creatures and card advantage engines like Glint-Sleeve Siphoner, this deck aims to outpace and overpower the opponent in the early to mid-game.

This deck focuses on controlling the board by using artifacts to disrupt the opponent's strategy while also improving your own board state. By utilizing cards that allow you to improvise your mana costs, you can cast powerful spells earlier than expected. The key strategy is to establish board presence with artifact creatures and use cards like Karn, Scion of Urza and Herald of Anguish to generate card advantage and control the game. The deck also includes some removal and life gain to help stabilize against aggressive opponents.

This Mono Green Aggro deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with Llanowar Elves and Greenbelt Rampager to drop powerful creatures like Steel Leaf Champion and Ghalta, Primal Hunger. The deck also includes cards like Blossoming Defense and Scrapheap Scrounger for added resilience and flexibility. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, high-powered creatures and efficient combat tricks while maintaining a strong board presence. Additionally, the inclusion of vehicles like Heart of Kiran and Skysovereign, Consul Flagship adds another dimension to the deck's attacking strategy.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with efficient creatures and powerful burn spells. The key is to maintain a constant stream of aggression by playing low-cost threats such as Soul-Scar Mage and Scrapheap Scrounger, while utilizing powerful finishers like Rekindling Phoenix and Hazoret the Fervent to close out games. The inclusion of burn spells like Abrade and Unlicensed Disintegration provide removal for opposing threats and help push through damage. Chandra, Torch of Defiance provides additional card advantage and flexibility, ensuring a constant pressure on the opponent.

This Rakdos aggro deck focuses on early aggression and burn spells to quickly reduce the opponent's life total. It features powerful threats like Rekindling Phoenix and Glorybringer, supported by efficient removal spells like Unlicensed Disintegration and Abrade. The deck also utilizes versatile cards like Chandra, Torch of Defiance and Karn, Scion of Urza for card advantage and additional threats. With a mix of creatures with haste and direct damage spells, this deck aims to pressure the opponent and close out the game swiftly.

The main focus of this UW Control deck is to counter and remove threats while generating card advantage through efficient card draw and card selection. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Settle the Wreckage and Seal Away, while also utilizing counterspells like Disallow and Essence Scatter to stop opponent's threats. Teferi, Hero of Dominaria provides card advantage and a win condition, while Search for Azcanta helps filter the deck. The deck also includes a few board wipes like Fumigate for additional control. The inclusion of Torrential Gearhulk provides additional value by flashing back powerful instant spells.
